duration.Description: For the seven 'rating_*' trial types, the durations are the response time in each rating; if no response was provided, the duration was set as 'n/a'. If you would like to model the rating period, you can use the maximum time for rating (5 seconds) to replace those missing values.

trial_type.Description: A categorical variable indicating event types within a trial

Levels.rating_relevance: the rating period for personal relevance
Levels.rating_warm: the rating period for warm and tender

response_value.Description: This value ranges from 0 ('Barely at all') to 100 ('Strongest imaginable'). Note that if the 'duration' of one rating event was 'n/a', the response value would also be 'n/a'.

stim_file.LongName: The name of the stimulus file in this trial
